intro: Elatostema quadribracteatum, commonly known as the four-bract elatostema, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, elliptical fruits. Elatostema quadribracteatum is often found in rocky or clayey soils and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
